raw_text:
GB quartet get cross country call
 
 Four British athletes have been pre-selected to compete at the World Cross Country Championships in March after impressive starts to the season.
 
 Hayley Yelling, Jo Pavey, Karl Keska and Adam Hickey will represent Team GB at the event in France. Yelling clinched the women's European cross country title last month and Pavey followed up with bronze. Keska helped the men's team to overall third place while Hickey finished in 10th place on his junior debut. "Winning the European cross country title meant so much to me," said Yelling. "And being pre-selected for the Worlds means that I can focus on preparing in the best way possible." The 32-year-old will race alongside Olympic 5,000m finalist Pavey in the women's 8km race on 19 March. Keska, who has made a successful return from a long-term injury lay-off, contests the men's 12km race on 20 March, while 16-year-old Hickey goes in the junior men's 8km on the same day. The rest of the team will be named after the trials at Wollaton Park in Nottingham, which take place on 5 March.
llama3.2:1b: British athletes Hayley Yelling and Jo Pavey have been selected to compete at the World Cross Country Championships in France. They are part of Team GB along with Karl Keska and Adam Hickey.
llama3.2:3b: Four British athletes have been pre-selected for the World Cross Country Championships: Hayley Yelling, Jo Pavey, Karl Keska and Adam Hickey. Yelling won the European cross country title and will compete alongside Pavey in France, while Keska helps the men's team to third place overall.
gemma2:2b: Four British athletes (Hayley Yelling, Jo Pavey, Karl Keska, Adam Hickey) have been pre-selected to compete for Team GB at the World Cross Country Championships in France in March.  The team will be finalized after trials in Nottingham.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Four British athletes have been selected to participate in the World Cross Country Championships in France in March after promising performances this season. They are Hayley Yelling, Jo Pavey, Karl Keska, and Adam Hickey. Yelling clinched a women's European cross country title last month, while Pavey followed up with bronze, Keska helped the men's team to third place, and Hickey finished 10th on his junior debut. The 32-year-old will race alongside Olympic 5,000m finalist Pavey in the women's 8km race and Keska in the men's 12km race, while Hickey goes in the junior men's 8km race.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Four British athletes, including Hayley Yelling and Karl Keska, have been pre-selected to compete at the World Cross Country Championships in March after impressively securing European cross country titles and placing highly in men's events. Yelling clinched the women's title and Pavey secured bronze; while Keska helped bring Team GB a third-place finish overall. The four will race alongside Olympic 5,000m finalist Jo Pavey in an 8km event on March 19th and 12km by Karl Hickey for Team GB at the junior men's event on March 20th. The rest of the team will be named after trials held in Wollaton Park on March 5th.
qwen2.5:3b: Four British athletes—Hayley Yelling, Jo Pavey, Karl Keska, and Adam Hickey—are pre-selected to compete at the World Cross Country Championships. Yelling won the European title and Pavey got a bronze medal. Keska helped his team finish third in men's competition after returning from injury, while Hickey placed 10th on his debut. Pre-selection will be announced after trials at Wollaton Park on March 5 for the remaining members of the team.
opencoder:1.5b: The GB quartet is scheduled to participate in the World Cross Country Championships and pre-select for the competition. They are keen to focus on preparing as much as possible. During their season, they have achieved major mileages in winning European titles and qualifying for Olympic games.

Other team members will compete in the trials at Wollaton Park on March 5.
